photo.description: This is famous world over. It it Big Ben, the clock tower of the Palace of Westminster. The clock that makes big bongs every hour. Big Ben is next to the House of Commons in the Palace of Westminster. The whole Palace is a Grade I listed building and a World Heritage Site. The tower was renamed Elizabeth Tower from September 2012, in honour of the Queen's Diamond Jubilee.

photo.description: April 2012. London, England. I couldn't come up with a unique take on this iconic landmark :-(, so I simply did the tourist thing. Since the weather was grey and drizzly, I opted for black and white. I was able to bring out a bit of detail in the sky that way. I used an orange filter in the B&W conversion which really brought out highlights in the stone.

photo.title: Big Ben - spring 2009

photo.description: Close-up of the west and north-facing clock-faces of the Clock Tower (Big Ben). The shields between the belfry stage and the cast iron roof represent: the red and white rose of the Tudor dynasty, the portcullis for the Tudors, the pomegranate for Katherine of Aragon, the thistle for Scotland, the leek for Wales, shamrock for Ireland and the fleur de lis for France. This image is subject to parliamentary copyright. Visit the Parliament website for more information about the Clock Tower.
photo.tags: bigben clocktower housesofparliament parliament london westminster clock ukparliament uk unitedkingdom houseofcommons houseoflords lords commons mp peers politics
photo.title: Clock Tower (Big Ben)

photo.description: This image shows Big Ben's damaged clock mechanism in 1976. At first thought to have been caused by a bomb, the damage actually resulted from the sudden fracture of the flyfan arbor of the chiming train. Consequently, there was no check on the 11/2 ton weight of the chiming mechanism, and wheels, gears, cams and clicks were flung at high speed around the clockroom, and even through the ceiling. No one was hurt, because the accident happened at 4am. This image is subject to parliamentary copyright. Visit the Parliament website for more information about the Clock Tower.
photo.tags: bigben clocktower parliament westminster london mps housesofparliament lords clocks clock ukparliament uk unitedkingdom houseofcommons houseoflords commons mp peers politics
photo.title: Big Ben: Damage to the clock mechanism 5 August 1976

photo.description: The Big Ben team meet for a rooftop breakfast of bacon sandwiches and tea in preparation for their long day. The team start at 6am and work through to past midnight to ensure Big Ben delivers the time and famous 'bongs' which welcome in the New Year across the country and are broadcast around the world. Clockwise from left: Lester Benjamin, Head of Palace Maintenance Services; Mel Barlex, Director of Estates; Huw Smith, Clock Mechanic; Mike McCann, Keeper of the Great Clock; Amanda Leck, Clock Tours Administrator; Ian Westworth, Clock Mechanic; Paul Roberson, Clock Mechanic; Kevin O'Connor, Shift Technician This image is subject to parliamentary copyright. Visit the Parliament website for more information about the Clock Tower.
photo.tags: bigben parliament newyear newyearseve ukparliament uk westminster london unitedkingdom housesofparliament houseofcommons houseoflords lords commons mp peers politics
photo.title: Breakfast on New Year's Eve

photo.description: What a tourist shot for tonight.. I wandered around the Victoria Gardens for a while, until I was almost locked in by some gobshite guard, didn't seem to like me walking at my own pace on the way out, and almost locked another couple of people in before I warned him and he let of a 'FFS'. Off with his head! :) I did find a plastic cow in the Parliament gardens though, no idea why it's there, even shows up on Google Maps, so it's clearly been there a while. Will get a better pic of it sometime and post that as proof. It was raining, (shocker), so I'm blaming that on my failure for something a little more original, I tried for a couple of hours but I'm not really that happy with most of the shots as I was trying to stop my stuff getting soaked. Going to have to invest in some rainbow things i think. Will have to go back there when it's not raining, as I think I could find some nice ones, not just the cow..

photo.description: Big Ben is the nickname of the Great Bell of Westminster, the hour bell of the Great Clock, hanging in the Clock Tower of the Palace of Westminster, the home of the Houses of Parliament in the United Kingdom. The bell was named "Big Ben" after Sir Benjamin Hall, the Chief Commissioner of Works when it was cast in 1856. Big Ben is commonly taken to be the name of the clock tower itself, but this is incorrect - the tower is simply known as The Clock Tower
photo.title: Clock Tower, Palace of Westminster, (London, UK)

photo.title: Remove

photo.description: The Clock Tower (Big Ben) mechanics use pre-1971 coins to alter the speed of the clock's pendulum. This picture shows a tin with some of the coins and the log sheet the mechanics use when they're correcting the speed of the pendulum. These images are subject to parliamentary copyright. Visit the Parliament website for more information about the Clock Tower.
photo.tags: parliament mps lords commons bigben clocktower housesofparliament houseofcommons houseoflords ukparliament uk westminster london unitedkingdom mp peers politics
photo.title: Big Ben: Pendulum coins and the log sheet
